title: Column Definitions
description: Columns are configured in the grid by providing a list of Column Definitions. The attributes you set on the column definitions define how the columns behave e.g. title, width etc.

title: Column Groups
description: Columns can be grouped together into Column Groups. Additionally you can configure groups to be expandable to show and hide columns within the group.

title: Column Headers
description: The display of column headers can be fine-tuned to change Header Height and Text Orientation for example.

title: Column Resizing
description: Resize columns by dragging the edge of the column header, Auto Fill to fill the grid width, or Auto Size columns to fit their content.

title: Column Filter
description: Column Filters appear in the column menu. The grid comes with filters out of the box: text, number, date and set filters. You can also create your own customer filter.
snippet: colDef.filter = true

title: Text Filter
description: Text Filter allows filtering text strings with {equals, notEqual, contains, notContains, startsWith, endsWith}.

title: Number Filter
description: Number Filter allows filtering numbers with {equals, notEquals, lessThanOrEqual, greaterThan, greaterThanOrEqual, inRange}

title: Date Filter
description: Date Filter allows filtering dates with {equals, notEquals, lessThanOrEqual, greaterThan, greaterThanOrEqual, inRange}.

title: Set Filter
description: Set Filter works like Excel, providing checkboxes to select values from a set.

title: Custom Filter
description: Create your own Custom Filter to match your own business requirements.

title: Quick Filter
description: Quick Filter filters all columns simultaneously with a simple text search, just like how you filter your Gmail.

title: External Filter
description: External Filter allows you to build filters that live outside of the grid. For example, you can include your own widgets outside the grid for your own filter.

title: Row Dragging
description: Row Dragging allows you to re-arrange rows by dragging them.

title: Row Sorting
description: Row Sorting will sort the data. Sort a column by clicking the header. Sort multiple columns by holding down Shift.
snippet:
// enable sorting with column option
colDef.sortable=true

title: Row Selection
description: Row Selection to select rows. Choose between click selection or checkbox selection. Selecting groups will select children.

title: Range Selection
description: Drag the mouse over cells to create a Range Selection. This is handy for highlighting data or for copying to the clipboard.

title: Grid Size
description: Set the Width and Height of the grid using CSS. If your application changes the size of the grid at run time, the grid will dynamically adjust to the new size.
snippet:
<!-- set using exact pixel -->
<ag-grid style="height: 200px; width: 400px;"/>

<!-- or set using percent -->
<ag-grid style="height: 100%; width: 100%;"/>

title: Column Spanning
description: Column Spanning allows cells to span columns, similar to cell span in Excel

title: Row Spanning
description: Row Spanning allows cells to span rows, similar to cell span in Excel

title: Column Moving
description: Columns can be moved inline by either dragging the column with the mouse, or my using the API.

title: Column Pinning
description: Use Column Pinning to pin one or more columns to the left or to the right. Pinned columns are always present and not impacted by horizontal scroll.
snippet:
var columns = [
    {field: 'athlete', pinned: 'left'},
    {field: 'total', pinned: 'right'},
    ...
]

title: Row Pinning
description: Use Pinned Rows to pin one or more rows to the top or the bottom. Pinned rows are always present and not impacted by vertical scroll.

title: Row Height
description: Rows can have different Row Height. You can even change the row height dynamically at run time.

title: Cell Styling
description: Use CSS rules to define Cell Style based on data content, e.g. put a red background onto cells that have negative values, and green on values greater than 100.

title: Value Getters & Value Formatters
description: Value Getters & Value Formatters are about getting and formatting the data to display. Use Value Getters when the data is not a simple field. Use Value Formatters to format values for display.

title: Setters and Parsers
description: Value Setters and Value Parsers are the inverse of value getters and value formatters. Value setters are for placing values into data when field cannot be used. Value parser is for parsing edited values, e.g. removing formatting before storing into the data.

title: Expressions
description: Expressions allow you to use simple strings instead of functions for value getters, setters, formatters and parsers.

title: Reference Data
description: Use Reference Data for easier editing of data that uses reference data for display. For example, you might have country codes in your data e.g. {IE, UK, USA} but you display values e.g. {Ireland, Great Britain, United States of America}). Using reference data simplifies this, especially if editing.

title: Cell Rendering
description: Use Cell Rendering to have cells rendering values other than simple strings. For example, put country flags beside country names, or push buttons for actions.

title: Cell Editing
description: Users can update data with Cell Editing. Use one of the provided cell editors or create your own to suit your business needs.

title: Keyboard Navigation
description: With Keyboard Navigation users can use cursor keys and tab keys to navigate between cells.

title: Touch Support
description: User can navigate the features of the grid on a touch device with the built-in Touch Support. You don't need to do anything, it works out of the box.

title: Animation
description: Rows in the grid will Animate into place after the user sorts or filters.

title: Accessing Data
description: Once data is in the grid, you can Access the Data using the grid's API.

title: Pagination
description: Use Pagination when you don't want the user to have to scroll. Pagination allows viewing rows one page at a time.

title: Updating Data
description: Data can be updated in real time. The grid can highlight the change by flashing the cells or by animation inside the cell as the cell refreshes.

title: View Refresh
description: If the data changes outside of the grid, get the grid to do a View Refresh to update the UI to the latest values. The grid will use change detection to only refresh values that have changed.
snippet:
// refresh all cells in the grid
gridApi.refreshCells();

title: Change Detection
description: As you change data inside the grid, the grid runs Change Detection to check if any other cells need to be updated to reflect the change.

title: Localisation
description: Support different languages with Localisation.

title: Performance
description: The core grid engine gives Performance unlike that seen before. The grid uses row and column virtualisation, animation frames and many other techniques.

title: Accessibility
description: The grid has ARIA roles inside the cells for Accessibility to enable navigation with screen readers.

title: Full Width Rows
description: Full Width Rows allow you to have one cell that spans the entire width of the tables. This allows a card layout to work alongside the normal cells.

title: Master / Detail
description: Use Master Detail to expand rows and have another grid with different columns inside.

title: Aligned Grids
description: Have one or more grids horizontally Aligned so that any column changes in one grid impact the other grid. This allows two grids with different data to be kept horizontally in sync.

title: CSV Export
description: Use CSV Export to take data out of the grid and into another application for further processing such as Excel.

title: Excel Export
description: Export in native Excel Format which will maintain the column widths and also allow exporting of styles. For example, you can color cells in the grid and have the equivalent cells colored in the Excel export.

title: RTL
description: Use Right to Left alignment to allow languages such as Arabic & Hebrew.

title: Custom Icons
description: All the icons in the grid can be replaced with your own Custom Icons. You can either use CSS or provide your own images.

title: Overlays
description: Full control of Overlays to display messages to the user on top of the grid

title: Printing
description: Remove all scrolling in the grid to make it ready for printing.

title: Grouping Rows
description: Use Grouping Rows to group the data over selected dimensions. You can set the data to group by specific columns, or allow the user to drag and drop columns of their choice and have it grouped on the fly.
snippet:
columnDefs = [
    {field: 'country', rowGroup: true},
    {field: 'sport'},
    ...
]

title: Tree Data
description: Use Tree Data to display data that has parent / child relationships where the parent / child relationships are provided as part of the data. For example, a folder can contain zero or more files and other folders.

title: Aggregation
description: When grouping you can also do Aggregation to get aggregate values for the data i.e. sum, min, max etc. Use the built in aggregate functions or create your own.
snippet:
columnDefs = [
    {field: 'country', rowGroup: true},
    {field: 'gold', aggFunc: 'sum'},
    ...
]

title: Pivoting
description: Make columns out of values by Pivoting on the data, similar to Pivot Tables in Excel.
snippet:
columnDefs = [
    {field: 'country', rowGroup: true},
    {field: 'sport', pivot: true},
    {field: 'gold', aggFunc: 'sum'},
    ...
]

title: Tool Panel
description: The Tool Panel allows the user to manipulate the list of columns, such as show and hide, or drag columns to group or pivot.

title: Clipboard
description: Copy and paste data to and from the Clipboard. Users will be able to edit data in Excel, then copy the data back into the grid when done.

title: Column Menu
description: The Column Menu drops down from the column header. Use the default options or provide your own.

title: Context Menu
description: The Context Menu appears when you right click on a cell. Use the default options or provide your own.

title: Status Bar
description: The Status Bar appears on the bottom of the grid and shows aggregations (sum, min, max etc.) when you select a range of cells using range selection. This is similar to what happens in Excel.

title: License Key
description: Each customer of AG Grid Enterprise will be given a License Key to put into their application.
